titleInfo.title: How is information distributed across speech and gesture? A cognitive modeling approach

mods.abstract: In naturally occurring speech and gesture, meaning occurs organized and distributed across the modalities in different ways. The underlying cognitive processes are largely unexplored. We propose a model based on activation spreading within dynamically shaped multimodal memories, in which coordination arises from the interplay of visuo-spatial and linguistically shaped representations under given cognitive resources. A sketch of this model is presented together with simulation results.
